title: Carnival Posters and Wood Types
content:
Fantastic collection of carnival and fair posters here at the Triangle Poster and Printing Co. of Pittsburgh, PA:   
 [http://www.triangleposter.com/posters.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809002610/http:/www.triangleposter.com/posters.html)   
   
There's some wonderful, "primitive" layouts here, and tons of fantastic wood type lettershapes.
author: mart

comments.content:
Althought not strictly a carnival or fair image, this is a nice example of the work at this site:   
 [http://www.triangleposter.com/images/jpg/513\_Y.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809002610/http:/www.triangleposter.com/images/jpg/513_Y.JPG)

And how the hell do you put an image in a post here? The instructions are as clear as mud. I did what I thought it told me to do:   
.........   
GIF / JPG:   
 ![1,Text Description](http://web.archive.org/web/20140809002610im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/your_image.gif)   
.........   
(Your instructions)   
and got an error message.   
   
This may be understandable to html coders, but not me.   
Sorry to whine, but if it was easier to understand, and easier to post images then these forums would benefit from a lot more imagery.

And how the hell do you put an image in a post here? The instructions are as clear as mud. I did what I thought it told me to do:   
.........   
GIF / JPG:   
-backslash-image{Text Description}   
.........   
(Your instructions)   
and got an error message.   
   
This may be understandable to html coders, but not me.   
Sorry to whine, but if it was easier to understand, and easier to post images then these forums would benefit from a lot more imagery.
